word: We shall keep a free hotel as long as we are living in Granville; for there is no other way to do. We shall have to have council meetings and committee meetings at our home, and those who come to these meetings must be entertained at our house, and sit at our table. We like to have them here, but it is almost a constant draft upon us.--Letter 11, 1895, pp. 7, 10, 11. (To Elder S. N. Haskell, January 30, 1895.)
